title: The Wealth Company MF files drafts documents for first SIFs - Equity Long Short and Equity Ex-Top 100 Long Short
author: Moneycontrol News
content:
The Wealth Company Mutual Fund has filed draft documents for its first specialised investment strategies under its Wealth Select Investment Fund's under the WSIF platform—WSIF Equity Long-Short Fund and WSIF Equity Ex-Top 100 Long-Short Fund.

According to the filings, both strategies will employ a long-short equity approach, investing primarily in listed equities and equity-related instruments while taking limited short exposure through derivative instruments.

The WSIF Equity Long-Short Fund will invest across the broader equity market, while the WSIF Equity Ex-Top 100 Long-Short Fund will focus on stocks outside the top 100 by market capitalization, targeting opportunities in the mid- and small-cap segments. The investment objective for both strategies is to generate long-term capital appreciation through a diversified portfolio structure. The NIFTY 500 Total Return Index (TRI) has been selected as the benchmark for both funds.

Units of the strategies will be offered at a face value of Rs 10 during the New Fund Offer (NFO) period and thereafter at NAV-based prices. Post allotment, the strategies will reopen for continuous sale and repurchase within five business days. Subscriptions and redemptions will be permitted on all business days, with redemption proceeds expected to be dispatched within three working days under normal circumstances. The units are not proposed to be listed on any stock exchange.

The Wealth Company's WSIF platform recieved approval from the regulator in November 2025. Chinmay Sathe has been appointed as Chief Investment Officer & Head – SIF, The Wealth Company.
